biography_text: KILDEE, Dan,  (nephew of Dale Edward Kildee), a Representative from Michigan; born in Flint, Genesee County, Mich., August 11, 1958; graduated from Flint Northern High School, Flint, Mich., 1976; attended University of Michigan, Flint, Mich.; B.S., Central Michigan University, Mount Pleasant, Mich.; founder, Genesee County Land Bank; co-founder and chief executive, Center for Community Progress; member of the Flint, Mich., board of education, 1977-1985; member of the Genesee County, Mich., board of commissioners, 1985-1997; Genesee County, Mich., treasurer, 1997-2009; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Thirteenth and to the two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2013-present).

post_secondary_degrees.institution: Central Michigan University, Mount Pleasant, Mich.
